main event: A silver-blue light, brighter than a 1st magnitude star, was observed above the horizon in Jamestown, New York on August 23, 1965, lasting for 4-5 minutes.
interesting points: The object moved slowly to the south and disappeared over the horizon., Heavy static and distorted TV picture occurred during the sighting., The observer reported seeing the same object two days earlier but didn't report it., The object was approximately 1000 feet away and at the same altitude when viewed more closely., Neighbors were present and reportedly excited about the sighting, ruling out a hoax by children.
witness description: neighbors and a 15-year-old youth who observed the object
